column1: Appendix table 21. Stratification and weighting of problem-solving courts, 2012
Report title: Census of Problem-Solving Courts, 2012 NCJ 249803
Data source: Census of Problem-Solving Courts, 2012
Authors: Suzanne M. Strong, Ph.D., and Ramona R. Rantala, Tracey Kyckelhahn, Ph.D.
Appendix table 21. Stratification and weighting of problem-solving courts, 2012

Note: Courts were stratified by type. Drug courts were further stratified by population of service area, as follows: Drug (small population) included drug courts in counties with populations of 55,200 or fewer; Drug (medium population), populations between 55,201 to 219,992; and Drug (large populations), populations greater than 219,993.
a/Handles alcohol- or drug-dependent offenders also charged with a driving offense.
Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, Census of Problem-Solving Courts, 2012.
